page.title: 07LACK OF AMENITIES ON ARNE
page.content: Arne has no bus service and the nearest railway is five miles away.There is one public right of way and also one arterial road which leads nowhere.Arne is accessible by foot, car,bicycle and by boat.All of the houses have telephones,but there is no public telephone.A Post Office van brings and collects mail. At present there are l2 dwellings ,one is a farm house of a new design and one the old schoolhouse.There are l9 residents on the peninsula and 2 on the Islands.There is no mains water on Arne,but instead there is a spring and a borehole.There is no piped sewage system or gas available,but all houses have electricity. The extensive Nature Reserve of l300 acres is recorded and preserved by the RSPB. It is not , however, an amenity as such.
